defs: = ಅಲ್ಪಸರ.
that which does not have normal physical or mental strength.
a comfort or joy that lasts for a very short time.
one who longs for the ephemeral pleasure.
one who does not have many (male) offsprings.
a very small or meagre portion (of a whole).

its wool.
a cloth made of alpaca's wool.
that which has less or minimum number of letters or syllables.
the shortened process of ಆಚಮನ (rinsing the mouth, sipping water before religious ceremonies, before and after meals etc., from the palm of the hand); (cf.ಶುದ್ಧಾಚಮನ).
= ಅಲ್ಪಶಂಕೆ.
(in pair or in comparison) small and large; insignificant and important; little and big.
(pl.) matters that are small and large or insignificant and important or little and big.
a short-lived person.
short or shorter life-span; a life shorter than the normal.

a short-lived person.
short shorter life-span; a life shorter than the normal.

a short-term; a short period of time.
a loan for which the repayment period is relatively short; a short-term loan.

small - a) little in size, esp. when compared with others of the same kind; not large or big; limited in size; b) little in quantity, extent, numbers, value, duration, etc; c) of little importance or significance; trivial; d) small-minded; mean; petty.

a particle of negation or word expressing the idea of the word 'no' of English; not.

term - a) a set date, as for payment, termination of tenancy, etc.; b) a set period of time; duration; esp. a) a division of a school year, as a semester or quarter, during which a course of studies is given; b) the stipulated duration of an appointment to a particular office; c) the time for which anything lasts; d) time or space between.
an opportunity - a combination of circumstances favourable for the purpose; fit time; b) a good chance or occasion, as to advance oneself.
a hole; a narrow gap or a pit in the ground.
at or relating to a turning point.
terminating; at or relating to the maximum point.
that temperature above which a given gas cannot be liquefied, regardless of the pressure applied; critical temperature.

a critical angle - a) the least angle of incidence at which a ray is totally reflected; b) that angle of attack at which the flow of air around an airfoil suddenly changes, with an abrupt reduction in lift and an increase of drag.
a mystic accomplishment which enables to know things beyond the reach of the senses (but not absolute).

a mystic whose faculty of perceiving extends even to what is not within the reach of the senses.
